result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy L Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -Pay Restitution in the amount of $8,296.95 to National Stores, Inc. during the period of Probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

-Pay Extradition costs in the amount of $1,276.50 during the period of Probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Pay Extradition costs in the amount of $1,829.35 during the period of Probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Extradition Costs payable to the Milwaukee County Treasurer, and should be directed to the attention of Deputy District Attorney James Martin. 
-Provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge during the period of Probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
- Court WAIVED all MANDANTORY and NON-MANDATORY court costs and fees due to Restitution and Extradition costs.

*Court advised Defendant due to felony conviction, the Defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised Defendant due to felony conviction, the Defendant's voting rights are suspended and she may not vote until her civil rights are restored.
-Mental Health Assessment, comply with recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy L Martinez

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amy L Martinez in Court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Amy L Martinez in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Sentencing hearing. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court sentenced the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the County Jail, with credit for 63 DAYS time served.  
Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence,  and placed the Defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.
If revoked, NO RELEASE privileges. 
***Court does not object to sentence being served out of State. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Mental Health Assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-AODA Assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Pay Restitution in the amount of $8,296.95 to National Stores, Inc. during the period of Probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Pay Extradition costs in the amount of $1,276.50 during the period of Probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Pay Extradition costs in the amount of $1,829.35 during the period of Probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Extradition Costs payable to the Milwaukee County Treasurer, and should be directed to the attention of Deputy District Attorney James Martin. 
-Provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge during the period of Probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Court WAIVED all MANDANTORY and NON-MANDATORY court costs and fees due to Restitution and Extradition costs. 

*Court advised Defendant due to felony conviction, the Defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised Defendant due to felony conviction, the Defendant's voting rights are suspended and she may not vote until her civil rights are restored.
*Court advised Defendant of her right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed: PreTrial Sentence Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Amy L Martinez in Court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Amy L Martinez in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense counsel and Defendant. Sidebar conversation held in chambers. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Jury Instructions; received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised Defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised Defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Court advised Defendant that the No Contact Order remains in effect. 

Case is adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 10. State to comply with Victim Notification. Restitution and Extradition costs will be addressed at Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Level 5 Supervision, All other conditions of bail to remain the same.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Amy L Martinez not in court, in custody and not produced.  Lucy Kronforst on behalf of Alicia Kort and Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant's appearance waived for today's proceedings. Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2018 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 6/13/2018.
Bench Warrant in file.  
Case is adjourned on 6/19/2018 at 8:30 am for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 10.
Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.

For reasons stated on the record by defense, State requests a bench warrant issued.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered NO bail posted to be forfeited at this time.

Defendant's appearance waived for today's proceedings, defendant in Arizona for treatment.   For reasons stated on the record, the Court ordered that stayed bench warrant is continued.   All parties are advised effective February 6, 2017 case will be in Room 512 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with National Stores, Inc.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Amy L Martinez in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Amy L Martinez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
